Package io.dimeformat

Class Message

java.lang.Object
io.dimeformat.Item
io.dimeformat.Data
io.dimeformat.Message
public class Message extends Data
A class that can be used to create secure and integrity protected messages, that can be sent to entities, who may verify the integrity and trust of the message. Messages may also be end-to-end encrypted to protect the confidentiality of the message payload.

  • Constructor Details

    • Message

      public Message​(UUID issuerId)
      Creates a message from a specified issuer (sender).
      Parameters:
      issuerId - The issuer identifier.

    • Message

      public Message​(UUID issuerId, long validFor)
      Creates a message from a specified issuer (sender) and an expiration date.
      Parameters:
      issuerId - The issuer identifier.
      validFor - The number of seconds that the message should be valid for, from the time of issuing.

    • Message

      public Message​(UUID audienceId, UUID issuerId)
      Creates a message to a specified audience (receiver) from a specified issuer (sender).
      Parameters:
      audienceId - The audience identifier. Providing -1 as validFor will skip setting an expiration date.
      issuerId - The issuer identifier.

    • Message

      public Message​(UUID audienceId, UUID issuerId, long validFor)
      Creates a message to a specified audience (receiver) from a specified issuer (sender), with an expiration date.
      Parameters:
      audienceId - The audience identifier. Providing -1 as validFor will skip setting an expiration date.
      issuerId - The issuer identifier.
      validFor - The number of seconds that the message should be valid for, from the time of issuing.

    • Message

      public Message​(UUID audienceId, UUID issuerId, long validFor, String context)
      Creates a message to a specified audience (receiver) from a specified issuer (sender), with an expiration date and a context. The context may be anything and may be used for application specific purposes.
      Parameters:
      audienceId - The audience identifier. Providing -1 as validFor will skip setting an expiration date.
      issuerId - The issuer identifier.
      validFor - The number of seconds that the message should be valid for, from the time of issuing.
      context - The context to attach to the message, may be null.

  • Method Details

    • getHeader

      public String getHeader()
      Description copied from class: Item
      Returns the item header of the DiME item. This can be used to identify the type of DiME item held in this generic class. It is also used in the exported DiME format to indicate the beginning of a DiME item inside an envelope. Typically, this is represented by a short series of letters.
      Overrides:
      getHeader in class Data
      Returns:
      The item header of the DiME item.

    • getPublicKey

      public Key getPublicKey()
      Returns a public key that was included in the message. Normally this public key was used for a key exchange where the shared key was used to encrypt the payload. This is optional.
      Returns:
      A public key.

    • setPublicKey

      public void setPublicKey​(Key publicKey)
      Sets a public key that will be included in the message. This may be a public key that was used to derive a shared key used for encrypting the payload. This is optional.
      Parameters:
      publicKey - The public key to set.

    • setPayload

      public void setPayload​(byte[] payload, Key firstKey, Key secondKey) throws CryptographyException
      Will encrypt and attach a payload using a shared encryption key generated from the provided keys. The two keys provided must not be null and only one must contain a secret (private) key, the order does not matter.
      Parameters:
      payload - The payload to encrypt and attach to the message, must not be null and of length 1 or longer.
      firstKey - The first key to use, must have capability EXCHANGE, must not be null.
      secondKey - The second key to use, must have capability EXCHANGE, must not be null.
      Throws:
      CryptographyException - If something goes wrong.

    • setPayload

      public Key setPayload​(byte[] payload, Key key) throws CryptographyException
      Will encrypt and attach a payload using the private key. The provided key may either have the capability EXCHANGE or ENCRYPT. If EXCHANGE is used, then a second key will be generated and then used to generate a shared encryption key with the provided key. The public key of the generated EXCHANGE key will be set in the "pub" claim (getPublicKey()), but also returned. If a key with capability ENCRYPT is used, then the payload will be encrypted with this key. This key will then be returned. The unique id of the encryption key will be set in the key id ("kid") claim.
      Parameters:
      payload - The payload to encrypt and attach to the message, must not be null and of length 1 or longer.
      key - A key to either use for generating a shared key (EXCHANGE) or encrypting the message directly (ENCRYPT).
      Returns:
      The generated EXCHANGE key, or the encryption key (if provided key had capability ENCRYPT).
      Throws:
      CryptographyException - If something goes wrong.

    • getPayload

      public byte[] getPayload​(Key firstKey, Key secondKey) throws CryptographyException
      Returns the decrypted message payload, if it is able to decrypt it. Two keys must be provided, where only one of the keys may contain a secret (private), the order does not matter. The keys provided must be the same as when used setPayload(byte[], Key, Key) or equivalent, although it may be the opposite pair of public and public/secret.
      Parameters:
      firstKey - The first key to use, must be of type EXCHANGE, must not be null.
      secondKey - The second key to use, must be of type EXCHANGE, must not be null.
      Returns:
      The decrypted message payload.
      Throws:
      CryptographyException - If something goes wrong.

    • getPayload

      public byte[] getPayload​(Key key) throws CryptographyException
      Returns the decrypted message payload, if it is able to decrypt it. The provided key may either have the capability EXCHANGE or ENCRYPT. If EXCHANGE is used, then the "pub" claim will be used as a source for the second exchange key to use when generating a shared encryption key. If the key has capability ENCRYPT, then the payload will be decrypted using the provided key directly.
      Parameters:
      key - A key to either use for generating a shared key (EXCHANGE) or decrypting the message directly (ENCRYPT).
      Returns:
      The decrypted message payload.
      Throws:
      CryptographyException - If something goes wrong.
